displayed_text: Patient: Until the third of January or something. Doctor: You could wait until the third of January, or you could -- Patient: Now, if you got - You, you – I grabbed that number out of the air. You can – Doctor: You could try to wait or things like that. Healthcare Professional: Yeah, he could wait. Yeah. Doctor: Okay. Because, again, I like to wait a little bit. Patient: After the, uh, hormones? Doctor: Yeah. Patient: Okay. Doctor: We have some data that says says, um, people tolerate the chemo better once, uh, they have a little bit more space between getting the hormones and the chemo together. So Patient: Okay. Doctor: Let your body’s level of testosterone drop. Then, get the chemo, uh - that may be safer on your bone marrow than doing it all at once. Patient: That’s a done deal.

Patient: Sure. Doctor: …after surgery because we want the healing process to be well established before we throw in kind of a wild card like radiation that Patient: Mmm. Doctor: might have some impact on healing. So we want you continent of urine, we want you you know having good control of your urine before we… Patient: Okay. Doctor: …we would refer. Healthcare Professional: Right he’s doing really well in that regard. Doctor: Good. Okay. Patient: Not bad. (Laughs) Doctor: Good, good. Patient: I’m going more often than I used to, but I mean that’s old age and what we’ve done I’m sure. Doctor: Yes, exactly.

Patient: Hum. Doctor: So but enough change that, that I think we’re probably not going in the- Patient: In the right direction. Doctor: In the right direction. So I think you know we didn’t get much response to the enzalutamide or that. It sounds, it seems like your cancer may just not be hormonally sensitive at this point. Patient: Okay. Doctor: To kind of go both ways, a low hormone, high hormone. Patient: Right. Right. Doctor: Uh we often see after folks have been on what is also known as Zytiga- Patient: I was on it. Doctor: Yeah. We get, we get sort of resistance that carries through there. Patient: Ohh. Doctor: So that means uh we need to take you off. I mean the testosterone part of this, the input of the study was PSA going down. So you already, you have gone up a little. So you already hit that.
